titleStmt.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE and most Noble Brothers: The Lord WILLIAM, Earle of Penbrook, And Lo. PHILIP, Earle of Montgomery.
titleStmt.author: Blount, Edward

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE and most Noble Brothers: The Lord WILLIAM, Earle of Penbrook, And Lo. PHILIP, Earle of Montgomery.
analytic.author: Blount, Edward

monogr.title: Ars aulica or The courtiers arte
monogr.author: Ducci, Lorenzo

div.head: TO THE RIGHT HONOVRABLE and most Noble Brothers: The Lord WILLIAM, Earle of Penbrook, And Lo. PHILIP, Earle of Montgomery.
div.p:
RIght Honourable and worthie LORDS, This small Treatise hapning to speake English at this time; how I know not, but by a kinde of fate, should seeme destined
to your protection: who from your owne practise in Court can cleereliest iudge of his arte. You, whose indiuiduall and innated worths, besides my particular dutie, challenge this so equall Patronage; and binde me the most humbly deuoted to your honors.
